comments.body: nits: some things that the style guide goes into more detail that i happen to notice - constructor should go first, onConnecting et al should be renamed according to the naming scheme described in the style guide, please don't use abbreviations in identifier names (e.g. "o"), please don't use `=>` in multiline expressions; if you have a newline after an open parenthesis, please have a newline before the matching close parenthesis. Also, in general, please prefer readability over strict adherence to 80-character limits.
Oh, and please put spaces just inside named argument lists.
I think a complete working app is a useful example, however that sort of thing should probably end up in the nascent sample catalog - https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/9912
Because if they were code, they should really be `const`, but can't now due to an analyzer bug. And they are not so much code as an indication of values.
